propcomment: Damages: damaged embassy with axes, hammers, etc.
Damages: melee, extent of damage unknown (bank)

summary: 04/30/1999: At 11:00 am local time, eight hooded individuals attacked a temp agency on Colon Avenue in Irun, Spain. Computers, shelves, and other items were thrown onto the floor in the office, but no one was injured. Jarrai, a pro-ETA Basque separatist youth organization, was suspected in the attack.
propcomment: Computers were trashed and shelves were broken
addnotes: Jarrai leaders had previously attacked targets of this kind.
scite1: "Spain: Pro-ETA Group Attacks Temp Agency in Irun," Madrid ABC, May 1, 1999.

summary: 11/08/1999: Fourteen unidentified youths armed with machetes boarded a Belize-owned ship near Escravos, Nigeria. They kidnapped an American and a Nigerian citizen. The hostages were freed on 11/12/1999.
weapdetail: The perpetrators used machetes in the attack.
scite1: Edward F. Mickolus, Terrorism, 1996-2001: A Chronology, Imprint Westport, CT: Greenwood Press, 2002.

summary: 01/04/2000: The International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) headquarters in Bogota, Colombia was attacked and forty people were taken hostage. The 100 unidentified perpetrators demanded that the government and the ICRC find them new homes. The hostage-takers had left their homes during the Colombian government's war with local rebel groups. There is no information on what happened to the hostages, but the ICRC suspended operations in the country following this attack.
corp1: International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC)
motive: The perpetrators wanted the government and the ICRC to find them new homes.
weapdetail: Sticks were used in this attack.
scite1: Edward F. Mickolus, Terrorism, 1996-2001 : A Chronology, Imprint Westport, CT: Greenwood Press, 2002.

summary: 04/12/2006: About 300 protesters of the Islamic Defenders' Front (FPI) attacked Playboy's Jakarta, Indonesia, office several days after the magazine's circulation commenced there by throwing stones at building and shattering windows. There were no casualties.
motive: Intimidate Playboy to stop publishing in Indonesia
weapdetail: The protesters threw stones in the attack.
propcomment: The storming of the building caused material damage.
addnotes: The FPI members were demonstrating against a number of issues, including the magazine's American ownership, availability of the magazine in outlets that could not be monitored, and the use of the word "Playboy" for the magazine's title. Most employees had left the building when the attack commenced to avoid injury. --A member of Islam Defender's Front, Ali Zaini was taken into custody April 17. The building's management asked Playboy Indonesia publisher to move outside the building and police asked it to leave Jakarta. --The magazine moved its editorial offices to mostly Hindu Bali island. The editor in chief of Playboy went on trial on charges of publishing indecent material the following December.
scite1: “Police to Question FPI over Attack on 'Playboy' Office,” The Jakarta Post, April 15, 2006.
scite2: “Jakarta: Playboy Office Attacked, Muslim Organisations Demand Magazine Be Banned,” Indonesia -- OSC Report in Indonesian, April 08, 2006.
scite3: “Muslim hardliners attack office of Indonesia's Playboy magazine,” Agence France Presse -- English, April 12, 2006..

summary: 12/31/2006: Members of Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha - Jwala Singh (JTMM-J) threw rocks at and then fired upon a van belonging to Kantipur Publications in Khadopul, Saptari, Nepal. JTMM-J's Saptari coordinator claimed credit for the attack, stating that it was in response to Kantipur Publications not giving priority to news related to JTMM. The vehicle was damaged, but passengers inside were not harmed.
gname: Janatantrik Terai Mukti Morcha- Jwala Singh (JTMM-J)
motive: The publication was not giving priority to news related to JTMM-J
weapdetail: The attackers first threw rocks at the vehicle, damaging it, and then later fired on the vehicle.
propcomment: The front and sides of the vehicle were damaged by thrown stones.
scite1: "JTMM opens fire on Kantipur vehicle," ekantipur.com, December 31, 2006

location: The attack occurred in Mahimangwadi and Chotedonagar area on the Orcha Road in Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh, India
summary: 06/03/2008: On Tuesday, 25 - 30 Communist Party of India Maoist militants pulled down 14 electricity poles in the Mahimangwadi and Chotedonagar area on the Orcha Road in Narayanpur, Chhattisgarh, India. No casualties were reported.
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
weapdetail: Iron rods were used to dig up the base of the poles.
propcomment: An unknown amount of damage was done to the electricity poles.
scite1: South Asia Terrorism Portal, "Maoists Pull Down 14 Electricity Poles in Chhattisgarh," South Asia Terrorism Portal, http://www.satp.org/satporgtp/detailed_news.asp?date1=6/5/2008#10http://www.satp.org/satporgtp/detailed_news.asp?date1=6/5/2008#10.
scite2: Lexis Nexis, "Maoists Uproot Electric Lines to 50 Central India Villages," BBC Monitoring South Asia, June 4, 2008.

summary: 06/01/2011: On Wednesday, in the Cizre sub district of Sirnak, Turkey, Turkey, a group of 100 Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) members attacked the 13th century Red Madrassa with stones. The PKK members were attending a concert organized by the Peace and Democracy Party on a field near the building. Reports from the region said the attackers broke into the building and damaged the interior as well. All of the windows on the building were shattered in the attack, and no group has claimed responsibility.
motive: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
weapdetail: Stones were used in the attack.
propcomment: The attack shattered all the windows and damaged the interior of the Red Madrassa.
scite1: Today's Zaman, "PKK Supporters Attack Historic Shrine in Cizre," Today's Zaman, June 1, 2011, http://www.todayszaman.com/news-245846--pkk-supporters-attack-historic-shrine-in-cizre.html.
scite2: PKK Terrorism, "PKK Supporters Attack Historic Shrine in Cizre," http://www.pkkterrorism.org/2011/06/01/pkk-supporters-attack-historic-shrine-in-cizre/ (June 1, 2011).

summary: 05/22/2013: An assailant threw a smoke grenade into the Al Falah Braintree Islamic Centre in Braintree town, England, United Kingdom. The assailant then brandished knives and shouted, "Where is your Allah now?" There were no reported injuries or damages resulting from the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident, but the assailant was arrested before he had a chance to flee.
weapdetail: A smoke bomb and two knives were used in the attack.
scite1: "Braintree Mosque in shock after attack," Essex Enquirer, May 29, 2013.

summary: 05/04/2014: Assailants stormed police headquarters in Odessa city, Odessa oblast, Ukraine. There were no reports of casualties in the attack, but windows were broken. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed it to the Pro-Russia militia. Sources reported that the assailants were seeking the release of people who had been arrested in connection with the violence in Odessa on May 2, 2014.
weapdetail: Sticks were used in the attack.
propcomment: A police station was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "AFP: Around 3,000 Pro-Russian Militants Attack Police HQ in Ukraine's Odessa," AFP (North European Service), May 4, 2014.
scite2: "Ukraine police station in Odessa attacked," Al Jazeera, May 4, 2014.
scite3: "Pro-Russians storm police station in Odessa, Ukraine," Turkish Press, May 4, 2014.

summary: 09/25/2014: Assailants attacked the Minivan News office building in Male city, Male province, Maldives. There were no reported casualties; however, security cameras were damaged in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to Muslim fundamentalists.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the Minivan News office was targeted because the assailants believed it was not Islamic.
weapdetail: A machete was used in the attack.
propcomment: Two security cameras and a building were damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Maldives: Three Arrested in Connection With Minivan News Journalist's Disappearance," Minivan News Online, September 28, 2014.

location: The incident occurred along Crumlin Road in the Ardoyne neighborhood.
summary: 11/11/2015: Assailants attacked a house on Crumlin Road in Ardoyne neighborhood, Belfast, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom. There were no reported casualties in the attack, but the house was damaged. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to loyalists.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack may have been part of a larger trend of sectarian violence in Northern Ireland.
weapdetail: Hammers and crowbars were used in the attack.
propcomment: A house was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Attack on Catholic home blamed on loyalist gang," The Irish News, November 12, 2015.

location: The incident occurred in the northern Marousi neighborhood.
summary: 12/16/2015: Assailants attacked the Teiresias offices in Marousi neighborhood, Athens, Greece. No one was injured, although company property was damaged in the attack. Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the government and its new policies regarding taxes.
motive: Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in opposition to the government and its new policies regarding taxes.
weapdetail: Hammers and sledgehammers were used in the attack.
propcomment: Unspecified property was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Anarchists raid Teiresias HQ, no injuries," EKathimerini.com, December 16, 2015.
scite2: "Seven arrested for vandalizing offices as Rouvikonas claims responsibility," EKathimerini.com, December 16, 2015.

summary: 06/23/2016: Assailants attacked a Turkish mosque in Dodrecht, Netherlands. At least two people were wounded in the attack. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to the Kurdistan Workers' Party (PKK).
weapdetail: Iron bars were used in the attack.
propcomment: A mosque was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Turkish mosque vandalized in Netherlands," Anadolu Ajansi, June 24, 2016.
scite2: "Turkish mosque vandalized in the Netherlands," Daily Sabah, June 24, 2016.

location: The incident occurred at the University of Athens.
summary: 05/24/2017: Assailants armed with axes, hammers, and knives attacked the education faculty at University of Athens in Athens, Attica, Greece. There were no reported casualties. No group claimed responsibility for the incident; however, sources attributed the attack to anarchists.
corp1: National and Kapodistrian University of Athens
weapdetail: Axes, knives, and hammers were used in the attack.
propcomment: Posters were damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Anarchists upset student union elections, one hurt," EKathimerini.com, May 24, 2017.

location: The incident occurred in southern Amsterdam.
summary: 12/07/2017: An assailant armed with a bat attacked a kosher restaurant in southern Amsterdam, Netherlands. The assailant smashed the windows of the restaurant and then entered the building and removed an Israeli flag. There were no reported casualties in the incident. Saleh Ali, a former fighter in Syria and a Palestinian extremist, claimed responsibility and stated that he carried out the incident in order to "protest."
motive: A Palestinian extremist claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that he carried out the attack in order to "protest." Sources also noted that the assailant was carrying a Palestinian flag and removed the Israeli flag from the restaurant.
weapdetail: A bat was used in the attack.
propcomment: The assailant broke several windows and broke into a restaurant.
scite1: "Amsterdam kosher eatery assailant reportedly was ex-fighter from Syria," JTA, December 13, 2017.
scite2: "Palestinian who vandalized Amsterdam kosher eatery says he's not anti-Semitic," JTA, December 8, 2017.

location: The incident occurred in the Marousi area of the city
summary: 08/25/2018: Assailants attacked the offices of Mytilineos company in Marousi, Athens, Greece. There were no reported injuries, though the building was damaged in the attack. Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsibility for the incident and alleged that Vangelis Mytilineos had created his "empire by ripping natural resources, exploiting thousands of people who work for him and - as he has the right connections - making some very profitable deals especially with the national power company."
motive: Rubicon (Rouvikonas) claimed responsbility for the incident and alleged that Vangelis Mytilineos had created his "empire by ripping natural resources, exploiting thousands of people who work for him and - as he has the right connections - making some very profitable deals especially with the national power company."
weapdetail: Sledgehammers were used in the attack.
propcomment: The front of a building was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "State PAO: Greece: Daily Media Roundup Monday August 27, 2018," US Embassy Public Affairs Office, August 27, 2018.
